Key Match Events: Lakers' 20-point comeback was spoiled in the final moments against the Houston Rockets
Anthony Davis led the team with 30 points, 13 rebounds, and five blocks
Dorian Finney-Smith found LeBron James for a deep triple, but the shot was waved off due to an offensive foul
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Redick attributed the loss to the Lakers' inability to get defensive rebounds
Anthony Davis stated that the team's inability to grab rebounds was the difference in the game
LeBron James mentioned that the game wasn't lost due to a turnover or foul, but because of their inability to grab a rebound
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rockets outrebounded the Lakers 49-39, with 18 offensive boards resulting in 28 second-chance points
Steven Adams and Amen Thompson led the Rockets' big men, with Thompson recording a career-high 16 rebounds and 23 points
Others: The Lakers fell to 20-15 and dropped to fifth place in the Western Conference after the loss
The team will continue their tour of Texas as they head up to Dallas to play the Mavericks on Tuesday night
